title: Escandón
text:
Escandón is one of the <a href="Colonia%20%28Mexico%29">colonias</a> of <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a> that were founded at the beginning of the 19th century on crop terrains that were formerly part of the <a href="hacienda">hacienda</a>s. This colony formed part of the Hacienda de la Condesa, being property of the family Escandón, who fractionated the terrains situated south of this. The colony is divided in two: Escandón I and Escandón II, because of its big extension. The first section is located from the Patriotismo Avenue and confines with the <a href="Tacubaya">Tacubaya</a> neighborhood; whereas the second section extends from the <a href="Viaducto%20Miguel%20Alem%C3%A1n">Viaducto Miguel Alemán</a> and confines with the <a href="Condesa">Condesa</a> Neighborhood. Escandón II has greater economic and social success than its homologous.
The colony still preserves some of the constructions that were built in the first half of the 20th century, particularly from architectural styles as: <a href="Art%20Deco">art decó</a>, colonial Californian, and the <a href="Neocolonialism">neocolonial</a>. At the north, given the vicinity to the Tacubaya neighborhood, some examples of constructions that correspond to the <a href="Eclecticism%20in%20architecture">architecture ecléctica</a> can be appreciated. The greater part of the buildings constructed around the middle of the 20th century correspond to apartment buildings.
As many other colonies founded in the first half of the 20th century, Escandón has several services and businesses that aim to attend the local population; some examples of this are the Jardín Morelos park and the market established in front of it. In recent times, the neighborhood has experimented a development in real-estate activities because it is near neighborhoods of medium-high economic levels, like Condesa, <a href="Colonia%20Roma">Roma</a>, <a href="Colonia%20N%C3%A1poles">Nápoles</a> and <a href="Colonia%20del%20Valle">del Valle</a>.
Location.
Colonia Escandón lies in an almost entirely flat terrain that skirts the Lomas of Tacubaya (belonging to the terrains of <a href="Lomas%20de%20Chapultepec">Lomas of Chapultepec</a>) and the bank of the Lake of Chapultepec. It is delimited by the following avenues and neighborhoods: in the north by Eje 4 Sur "Benjamín Franklin", Baja California Avenue and <a href="Condesa">Colonia Condesa</a>; south, by <a href="Viaducto%20Miguel%20Alem%C3%A1n">Viaducto Miguel Alemán</a> and the Colonia <a href="San%20Pedro%20de%20los%20Pinos">San Pedro de los Pinos</a>, along with the <a href="Colonia%20N%C3%A1poles">Colonia Nápoles</a>; to the east, by Nuevo León Avenue and Colonia Roma; and west by Revolución Avenue and Tacubaya.
The neighborhood is part of the <a href="Miguel%20Hidalgo%2C%20Mexico%20City">Delegation Miguel Hidalgo</a> of <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a>.
In addition to the security and accommodation, the geographic location of the colony turns it into a good alternative for tourists in the large and agglomerated Mexico City; whether the city is visited by pleasure or by businesses, its roads of access connect it with a considerable quantity of tourist attractions and centres of businesses, that include two lines of system of metropolitan transport (or Metro), the <a href="Mexico%20City%20Metrob%C3%BAs">Metrobús</a>, <a href="EcoBici%20%28Mexico%20City%29">Ecobici</a>, as well as several routes of buses, included the Bicentenario line that runs along the Circuito Interior. Its excellent location has made real-estate prices to rise every day.
Division.
Colonia Escandón is divided in two by Patriotismo Avenue. On the east side the streets bear the names Comercio, <a href="Agriculture">Agricultura</a> and <a href="Mining">Minería</a> as well as those of some social movements (such as <a href="Syndicalism">Unión</a> and <a href="Agrarianism">Agrarismo</a>) and of some professions (<a href="Architect">Arquitectos</a>, Ingenieros). On the west side, the names of the streets correspond to important figures in the history of <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a> and <a href="Latin%20America">Latin America</a>, such as <a href="Salvador%20Alvarado">Salvador Alvarado</a> and <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Mart%C3%AD">José Martí</a>. Other streets are named for significant dates, like 11 de Abril (11 April), or 28 de Agosto (28 August). Up until the end of the 20th century, the residents of each street organised parties on the corresponding dates where they put out flags and shared food.
History.
Founded at the beginnings of the 20th century, the terrains that formed part of one of the most known <a href="haciendas">haciendas</a> and of greater extension in the west zone of the <a href="Valley%20of%20Mexico">Valley of Mexico</a>, the Hacienda de la Condesa, were oriented South. It is known that the outline and the division of the terrains were made by the Escandón Barrón brothers, whose family kept an intense activity in the creation of fraccionamientos and the real-state business in <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a> from finals of the Porfiriato.
Located in the vicinities of the then populated neighborhood of <a href="Tacubaya">Tacubaya</a>, considered place of entertainment of the high society of the capital, Escandón was urbanized in a faster way on the west side, in which some <a href="villa">villa</a>s were built. Beautiful residences of the final 19th century are conserved, of which a lot of have been destroyed to build high cost apartment buildings. The <a href="Colonia%20%28Mexico%29">Colonia</a> Escandón is considered as one of the neighborhoods of greatest Mexican ancestry.
With the end of the <a href="Mexican%20Revolution">Mexican Revolution</a> and the growth of <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a>, the development and population of the rest of the colony began. In the decade of 1930, between the <a href="Avenida%20Insurgentes">Insurgentes</a>, Nuevo León and Benjamín Franklin Avenues and the Sindicalismo street, the first fraccionamiento of Mexico City was stablished and named: "Insurgentes-Ejército Nacional", with houses in terrains that go from 140 to 380 square metres. The names of the fraccionamientos, as well as the streets', are due to the fact that it was created so that generals, colonels, and other revolutionary soldiers of high rank could have their houses, which made that this small zone renowned. In fact, some of their descendants still live in the same houses.
The destruction of these simple and beautiful architectonic features is growing day by day, which has caused that its inhabitants (some belonging to third or fourth generations) had united for preventing big constructing businesses from acquiring these houses for then demolishing them and build luxury apartment buildings that, due to its location, makes them highly demanded. It is regrettable that one of the chalets of the Sindicalismo street has been demolished despite of the protests and the protection of the INAH.
Many famous personalities and celebrities have lived in Escandon. When the <a href="Cristero%20War">Cristero War</a> ended, the Catholic temple Espíritu Santo was the first temple that rang its bells. Its construction, dating from the beginning of the 20th century, and its inner decoration, are national heritage.
It has been a neighborhood of renowned artists, creators, publicists, lawyers and scholars. The characteristic small businesses that make of the neighborhood a small village in the large and big Mexico City still survive thanks to the local support, however this 21st century is making the situation to change given the high demand of the zone, to which some people already call "the new <a href="Condesa">Condesa</a>". His inhabitants are protecting the original name.
Transport.
The routes of the Network of Transport of Passengers (RTP) of the Federal District, that go through the neighborhood, correspond to the routes of the Zona SurPoniente M-15, and are the Route 13-To and the Route 115-To.
The nearest subway stations belong to the ones of the "line 9" of the <a href="Mexico%20City%20Metro">Subway of Mexico City.</a> Both are found in the Northern part of the neighborhood and are the stations of <a href="Metro%20Patriotismo">Patriotismo</a> and <a href="Metro%20Chilpancingo">Chilpancingo</a>, which is found in the limits of the Colonia Escandón with the Condesa and Roma.
The stations of the <a href="Mexico%20City%20Metrob%C3%BAs">Metrobús</a> of the <a href="Federal%20district">Federal District</a> are located in the eastern part of the colony, in the Insurgentes Sur Avenue, in the Line 1 (Red Line); La Piedad and Nuevo León which is linked to Line 2 (Purple Line) that is situated in the northern part of the neighborhood, which runs along the Benjamín Franklin Avenue. These stations are Nuevo León, Escandón and Patriotism.
On 17 February 2010 the system <a href="EcoBici%20%28Mexico%20City%29">Ecobici</a> was inaugurated in the Federal District. The bike stations 77 (Choapan and Tamaulipas) and 83 (New León and Alfonso Reyes) are the nearest to the neighborhood.
On 7 November 2011 the plan of enlargement of the service <a href="EcoBici%20%28Mexico%20City%29">Ecobici</a> was officially announced, with new stations to be added to Escandón.
Since March 2015, the fourth generation stations of Ecobici were installed. Until December 2015 there were 11 stations existing in the neighborhood: 7 in Escandón II and 4 in Escandon I. These stations correspond to the 166, 167, 170 and 172 in Escandón I and 168, 169, 171, 173, 175, 181 and 182 in Escandón II. The roads were improved and new signals for cyclists were also installed.
Places of interest.
One of the main places of interest is the street José Martí, in which the Theatre Sandoval shows children plays; likewise, the church, the market and the cantina "El Fuerte de la Colonia", and small <a href="Seafood">marisquerías</a> and <a href="Brewery">breweries</a>, that are evidence of a place of people of medium class. Also on the street José Martí and passing the Patriotism Avenue, the famous cantina "El León de Oro" can be visited.
On Tuesdays, the open-air market is installed in the street of José Martí, and for the celebration of the <a href="Church%20of%20the%20Holy%20Spirit%20%28Mexico%20City%29">Parroquia del Espíritu Santo</a> a fair is installed with food and fair games. The street José Martí is the hallway of trade and food, therefore <a href="Mexican%20street%20food">antojitos</a>, juices, bakeries, or restaurants of Mexican food of greater preparation can be obtained.
It is very frequent that on Sundays the lateral lanes of the Patriotismo Avenue are closed, to allow the cyclists to follow their way up to the <a href="Chapultepec">Forest of Chapultepec</a>.
Also the Fiesta Inn Hotel is another landmark in the corner of <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Mart%C3%AD">José Martí</a> and Insurgentes Avenue, as well as the Angeles Hospital Mexico, which is on the street of Agrarismo.
On the street of Sindicalismo, the Junior Fitness Center is found holding a wide variety of installations: 14<a href="tennis%20court">tennis court</a>s, a semi olympic-size swimming pool, saunas, <a href="gym">gym</a>nasium, pool for kids, <a href="Hot%20tub">Jacuzzi</a> and a <a href="Squash%20%28sport%29">squash</a> room, among others.
As part of the remodelings in all the colony during the period of <a href="Gabriela%20Cuevas%20Barron">Gabriela Cuevas Barrón</a>, the construction of the "Faro del Saber Escandón", located at the center of the Jardín Morelos park began. The building harbours the following services:
The main aim of the institution is to approach the citizens to reading and cultural services of quality, with the creation of the building with a modern architectural style. As part of the programme, the park was modernized; they replanted the green areas, the children's playgrounds and some skateboarding facilities were built for the youth.
In addition to the <a href="Brewery">breweries</a>, <a href="Seafood">marisquerías</a> have been installed through all the colony, one of the biggest is found inside the market, and the smallest, in front of the Hospital Angeles Mexico, in the street of Agrarismo.
There is a small venue in the corner of José Martí and Minería called "El Vitaminas", where broths of beef are served with <a href="Corn%20tortilla">tortillas of</a> handmade corn, which are not expensive.
The Mexican Institute of the Audition and the Language can also be found on the street of Progreso.
Pulquerías.
In Escandón I the <a href="pulque">pulque</a>ría "El Pirata" is located, between the streets 13 de Septiembre and the street 11 de Abril, one block away from Viaducto Piedad, on the Patriotismo Avenue. Its interior still preserves the <a href="sawdust">sawdust</a> all over the floor, <a href="Azulejo">tiles</a> in the walls, a <a href="jukebox">jukebox</a>, the wooden barrels where the pulque is stored. The pulque is served in glass jars for those who are drinking it there or in plastic glasses for those who are taking-out. They offer <a href="Curing%20%28food%20preservation%29">curados</a> made of oat and of fruits of the season. The different sauces offered in a <a href="molcajete">molcajete</a> are also appreciated, especially the salsa borracha, prepared also with pulque, that is enjoyed as an appetizer.
Other places of interest.
Another point of interest is the Sports Center "Valle Escandón", in which sports-related and recreational activities are offered at low costs, as well as tournaments of <a href="indoor%20soccer">indoor soccer</a> for all ages. It is a place to meet for the families that live in the neighborhoods and his surroundings.
